biography.value:
Called the Faceless Lord and the Oozing Hunger in ancient grimoires, Juiblex is demon lord of slime and ooze, a noxious creature that doesnâ€™t care about the plots and schemes of others of its kind. It exists only to consume, digesting and transforming living matter into more of itself.

A true horror, Juiblex is a mass of bubbling slime, swirling black and green, with glaring red eyes floating and shifting within it. It can rise up like a 20-foot hill, lashing out with dripping pseudopods to drag victims into its bulk. Those consumed by Juiblex are obliterated.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Juiblex makes three &Reference[acid]{Acid} Lash attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 60/120 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 4d6 + @mod type=acid average=true]] damage. Any creature killed by this attack is drawn into Juiblexâ€™s body, here the corpse is dissolved after 1 minute.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Juiblex spews out a corrosive slime, targeting one creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a [[/save dex 21 format=long]] or take [[/damage 10d10 type=acid average=true]] damage. Unless the target avoids taking all of this damage, any metal armor worn by the target takes a permanent âˆ’1 penalty to the AC it offers, and any metal weapon the target is carrying or wearing takes a permanent âˆ’1 penalty to damage rolls. The penalty worsens each time a target is subjected to this effect. If the penalty on an object drops to âˆ’5, the object is destroyed. The penalty on an object can be removed by the mending spell.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Juiblex casts one of the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components and using &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20):

At will: detect magic

3/day each: contagion, gaseous form

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Lair Actions

On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Juiblex can take one of the following lair actions; it canâ€™t take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

Green Slime. A green slime (see the Dungeon Masterâ€™s Guide) appears on a spot on the ceiling that Juiblex chooses within the lair. The slime disintegrates after 1 hour.

Slippery Slime. Juiblex slimes a square area of ground it can see within the lair. The area can be up to 10 feet on a side. When the slime appears, each creature on it must succeed on a [[/save dex 21 format=long]] or fall &Reference[prone]{prone} and slide 10 feet in a random direction determined by a d8 roll. When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there, that creature must make the same save.

The slime lasts for 1 hour or until it is burned away with &Reference[fire]{fire}. If the slime is set on &Reference[fire]{fire}, it burns away after 1 round. Any creature that starts its turn in the burning slime takes [[/damage 4d10 type=fire average=true]] damage.

Sticky Slime. Juiblex slimes a square area of ground it can see within the lair. The area can be up to 10 feet on a side. When the slime appears, each creature in that area must succeed on a [[/save str 21 format=long]] or become &Reference[restrained]{restrained}. When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there, that creature must make the same save.

A &Reference[restrained]{restrained} creature is stuck as long as it remains in the slimy area or until it breaks free. The &Reference[restrained]{restrained} creature, or another creature that can reach it, can use its action to try to break free and must succeed on a DC 21 &Reference[str]{Strength} check.

The slime lasts for 1 hour or until it is burned away with &Reference[fire]{fire}. If the slime is set on &Reference[fire]{fire}, it burns away after 1 round. Any creature that starts its turn in the burning slime takes [[/damage 4d10 type=fire average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Regional Effects

The region containing Juiblexâ€™s lair is warped by its magic, creating one or more of the following effects:

Acidic Water. Small bodies of water, such as ponds or wells, within 1 mile of the lair turn highly acidic, corroding any object that touches them.

Corrupted &Reference[nat]{Nature}. Within 6 miles of the lair, all &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[med]{Medicine}) and &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[sur]{Survival}) checks have disadvantage.

Slime. Surfaces within 6 miles of the lair are frequently covered by a thin film of slime, which is slick and sticks to anything that touches it.

If Juiblex dies, these effects fade over the course of 1d10 days.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Juiblexâ€™s Lair

Juiblexâ€™s principal lair is known as the Slime Pits, a realm that Juiblex shares with Zuggtmoy. This layer of the Abyss, which is also known as Shedaklah, is a bubbling morass of fetid sludge. The landscape is covered in vast expanses of caustic slimes, and strange organic forms rise from the oceans of &Reference[ooze]{ooze} at Juiblexâ€™s command.

Juiblexâ€™s challenge rating is 24 (62,000 XP) when encountered in its lair.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Cultists of Juiblex

The Faceless Lord grants its cultists special abilities. Lesser followers can gain the Liquid Movement trait. The most dedicated devotees of &Reference[ooze]{ooze} can also gain the Slimy Organs trait.

Liquid Movement. As an action, this creature can move up to 20 feet through spaces no more than an inch in diameter. It must end this movement in a space that can accommodate its full size. Otherwise, it takes [[/damage 5 force average=false]] damage and returns to the space where it began this movement.

Slimy Organs. This creature has resistance to &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning}, &Reference[piercing]{piercing}, and &Reference[slashing]{slashing} damage from nonmagical attacks.

Whenever this creature suffers a critical hit or is reduced to 0 hit points, it sprays acid; each creature within 5 feet of it takes &Reference[acid]{acid} damage equal to its number of Hit Dice.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Juiblex can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creatureâ€™s turn. Juiblex regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Attack. Juiblex makes one &Reference[acid]{Acid} Lash attack.

Corrupting Touch (Costs 2 Actions). Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: [[/damage 4d6 + @mod type=poison average=true]] damage, and the target is slimed. Until the slime is scraped off with an action, the target is &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned}, and any creature, other than an &Reference[ooze]{Ooze}, is &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} while within 10 feet of the target.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Juiblex makes one &Reference[acid]{Acid} Lash attack.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: [[/damage 4d6 + @mod type=poison average=true]] damage, and the target is slimed. Until the slime is scraped off with an action, the target is &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned}, and any creature, other than an &Reference[ooze]{Ooze}, is &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} while within 10 feet of the target.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Foul. Any creature other than an &Reference[ooze]{Ooze} that starts its turn within 10 feet of Juiblex must succeed on a [[/save con 21 format=long]] or be &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} until the start of the creatureâ€™s next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If Juiblex fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Magic Resistance. Juiblex has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Regeneration. Juiblex regains [[/damage 20 type=heal average=false]] hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes &Reference[fire]{fire} or &Reference[radiant]{radiant} damage, this trait doesnâ€™t function at the start of its next turn. Juiblex dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesnâ€™t regenerate.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Spider Climb. Juiblex can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any.

The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

source.book: Playerâ€™s Handbook

description.value:
Your touch inflicts disease. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within your reach. On a hit, the target is &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned}.

At the end of each of the &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} targetâ€™s turns, the target must make a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw. If the target succeeds on three of these saves, it is no longer &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned}, and the spell ends. If the target fails three of these saves, the target is no longer &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned}, but choose one of the diseases below. The target is subjected to the chosen disease for the spellâ€™s duration.

Since this spell induces a natural disease in its target, any effect that removes a disease or otherwise ameliorates a diseaseâ€™s effects apply to it.

Blinding Sickness. Pain grips the creatureâ€™s mind, and its eyes turn milky white. The creature has disadvantage on &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} checks and &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throws and is &Reference[blinded]{blinded}.

Filth Fever. A raging fever sweeps through the creatureâ€™s body. The creature has disadvantage on &Reference[str]{Strength} checks, &Reference[str]{Strength} saving throws, and attack rolls that use &Reference[str]{Strength}.

Flesh Rot. The creatureâ€™s flesh decays. The creature has disadvantage on &Reference[cha]{Charisma} checks and vulnerability to all damage.

Mindfire. The creatureâ€™s mind becomes feverish. The creature has disadvantage on &Reference[int]{Intelligence} checks and &Reference[int]{Intelligence} saving throws, and the creature behaves as if under the effects of the confusion spell during combat.

Seizure. The creature is overcome with shaking. The creature has disadvantage on &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} checks, &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throws, and attack rolls that use &Reference[dex]{Dexterity}.

Slimy Doom. The creature begins to bleed uncontrollably. The creature has disadvantage on &Reference[con]{Constitution} checks and &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throws. In addition, whenever the creature takes damage, it is &Reference[stunned]{stunned} until the end of its next turn.

source.book: Playerâ€™s Handbook

macro.name: Contagion

description.value:
You transform a willing creature you touch, along with everything it's wearing and carrying, into a misty cloud for the duration. The spell ends if the creature drops to 0 hit points. An incorporeal creature isn't affected.

While in this form, the target's only method of movement is a flying speed of 10 feet. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has resistance to nonmagical damage, and it has advantage on &Reference[str]{Strength}, &Reference[dex]{Dexterity}, and &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throws. The target can pass through small holes, narrow openings, and even mere cracks, though it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces. The target can't fall and remains hovering in the air even when &Reference[stunned]{stunned} or otherwise &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated}.

While in the form of a misty cloud, the target can't talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can't be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. The target can't attack or cast spells.

source.book: Playerâ€™s Handbook
